solution_line_template: First find how many inches the hem is by multiplying the length in feet by the number of inches per foot: {dress_hem_feet} feet * {inches_per_foot} inches/foot = <<{dress_hem_feet}*{inches_per_foot}={dress_hem_inches}>>{dress_hem_inches} inches

Then divide the length in inches by the length of each stitch to find how many stitches Jenna makes: {dress_hem_inches} inches / {stitch_length_inches} inches = <<{dress_hem_inches}/{stitch_length_inches}={total_stitches}>>{total_stitches} stitches

Then divide the number of stitches by Jenna's stitching rate to find how long it takes her: {total_stitches} stitches / {stitches_per_minute} stitches/minute = <<{total_stitches}/{stitches_per_minute}={time_minutes}>>{time_minutes} minutes
